messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] need game
messages.msgSnippet: ... I know. I was just trying to worm my way out of a bad idea I gave Tuck, thinking that Camp Fire was just for girls. And I think she suggested gender bias
messages.messageBody:
On Sun, 12 Jan 2003 22:05:02 EST starsuncloud@... writes:
> Hey, that's gender bias!! There are some dang good women too...

I know. I was just trying to worm my way out of a bad idea I gave Tuck,
thinking that Camp Fire was just for girls. And I think she suggested
gender bias the other way, when I posted the idea of the girls doing
make-overs. I just can't win, can I????<grin>

Wende

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] need game
messages.messageBody:
>From: starsuncloud@...

<<Hey, that's gender bias!! There are some dang good women too...>>


I wasn't following this thread but just caught this bit now. Had to just
jump in and say that my husbands cousin is a makeup artist in Hollywood. She
has been for years and has been up for 2 emmys from two different shows. She
currently works on Alias. What a job she has!!! Her husband is a camera man
on Six Feet Under.

'Mary B

messages.subject: need game
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/12/03 1:37:54 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/12/03 1:37:54 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< And hey, the best hair
stylists and makeup artists in the world are men! >>

Hey, that's gender bias!! There are some dang good women too...
It's funny though, the guys at the store I work at have quite a
following...and I've seen the makeovers they do and mine are better.
Women think that if a guy is doing makeup, he's automatically really good
(otherwise why would a guy do it right? ) but that isn't always true.
I have to say, Kevin Aucoin was a miracle worker with makeup, I am sad that
there won't be anymore of his books...(he died a couple months ago) we all
learned a lot from him in the cosmetic world.

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
complicated ones aren't."
"Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com

messages.subject: need game
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/11/03 6:34:03 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/11/03 6:34:03 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< And Kathryn
piped up "Aren't the trees beautiful?"

And they were :-) >>

She's got an artists eye.....anyone can learn how to, but it seems to be
easier for some folks.
It's a way to revert back to the awe with which a toddler sees the world.

"Who walks the world with soul awake, finds beauty everywhere"

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
